subsection.title: 1. Write an equation in standard form

introduction.p: Before we can use Gaussian reduction, we must write each equation in standard form.

statement.p:
Write the equation in standard form.
3y-7=4z+x
6=-5z+2x

solution.p:
The standard form is ax+by+cz=d. We add or subtract appropriate terms on both sides of the equation.
-x+3y-4z=7,~ or ~x-3y+4z=-7
2x+0y-5z=6,~ or ~-2x+0y+5z=-6

statement.p:
Write the equation in standard form.
5-3x+4y=2z
y=8-2z

introduction.p: It is easier to use Gaussian reduction if the equations have integer coefficients.

statement.p:
Write the equation with integer coefficients.
\dfrac{1}{5}x-\dfrac{2}{5}y+z=-1
\dfrac{3}{4}x-y+\dfrac{5}{6}z=6
